section.heading: Notice; waiver.
section.text: A person, including a guardian, guardian ad litem, conservator, or other fiduciary, may waive notice by a signed writing. An individual for whom a guardianship or other protective order is sought, a ward, or a protected individual may not waive notice.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 1-402 of the Uniform Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Act (1982 Act).
